sentence:
Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) today released the following statement calling for congressional action that will help low-income families and small businesses, those most at risk of long-term economic harm from the coronavirus:

"We don't yet know how the coronavirus will ultimately affect the country, but we do know that low-income families and small businesses stand to lose the most economically if the virus spreads widely.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) released the following statement on using the military to break up protests:

"Defense Secretary Esper is right that the military has no place breaking up protests on American streets.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) today released the following statement on the administration's need for an Iran strategy that will reduce tensions in the Middle East and avoid war:

"As the fallout from the strike on Qassem Soleimani continues, it has become evident to me that this action was a mistake.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) delivered the following remarks on the Senate impeachment trial of President Trump:

            "The decision to remove a president at any point in their term -- but particularly nine months before an election -- is not something we should take lightly.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) today provided additional information on the Employee Retention Credit, a component of the recently enacted coronavirus economic assistance bill (CARES Act) designed to help businesses keep employees on payroll during the coronavirus crisis.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) today released the following statement on the vote to subpoena additional witnesses in the Senate impeachment trial:

"I'm very disappointed the Senate has decided not to seek testimony from senior officials with firsthand information of the president's actions with respect to Ukraine.
Senator Dianne Feinstein released the following Q&A on the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act, the coronavirusresponse and recovery bill passed March 26, 2020 in the Senate.
Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) called on the Trump administration to not implement a proposed 100 percent tariff on wines imported from the European Union.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) joined Senators Tina Smith (D-Minn.) Gary Peters (D-Mich.), Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.), Patty Murray (D-Wash.), Ron Wyden (D-Ore.) and a group of their colleagues to introduce the Free COVID-19 Testing Act, which would expand free tests to confirm coronavirus (COVID-19) infections.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) today released the following statement on actions taken by Governor Newsom and the CDC to slow the spread of the coronavirus:

            "With 475 confirmed coronavirus cases in California and six deaths, it's clear we need to do more to slow its spread.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) joined Senators Dick Durbin (D-Ill.), Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa) and 22 of their Senate colleagues to introduce a bipartisan resolution celebrating the 30th anniversary of the restoration of independence of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) today released the following statement on new federal funding for the health care system that was included in the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act, which has passed the Senate and House and is expected to be signed into law soon.

Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.), Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) and Senators Jeff Merkley (D-Ore.), Dick Durbin (D-Ill.) and Representatives Jerrold Nadler (D-N.Y), Zoe Lofgren (D-Calif.), Joaquin Castro (D-Texas) and Veronica Escobar (D-Texas), led 113 of their colleagues in submitting an amicus brief in Flores v Barr.

Today, Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) and Representatives John Garamendi, Josh Harder , Jim Costa and TJ Cox (all D-Calif.) issued the following statement after California released its voluntary agreement framework to water users:

          "Governor Newsom's framework for voluntary agreements is a step forward for the Delta.
Senator Scott was joined by Senate Education Committee Chairman Lamar Alexander (R-TN) and Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-CA).

If and when House Democrats stop wasting the nation's time and forge the courage to send over the articles of impeachment, the Senate will fulfill its constitutional obligation by examining the evidence collected by the House, hearing from both sides, and then rendering a verdict."

What Senate Democrats Are Saying About Speaker Pelosi's Impeachment Delay

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-CA): "The longer it goes on the less urgent it becomes.
Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) today joined Senators Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa), Cory Booker (D-N.J.) and a bipartisan group of senators to support the Safeguarding America's First Responders Act.

Senator Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) joined Senators Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.), Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) and Josh Hawley (R-Mo.) to introduce bipartisan legislation to encourage the tech industry to take online child sexual exploitation seriously.
